pull.title: Mention reporting security issues responsibly
pull.body: Add a notice about reporting security issues responsibly to the GitHub issue template.

events.body: Concept ACK, though, this reminds me, that we should offer a way how users can send encrypted mails to security@bitcoincore.org

Concept ACK.

> that we should offer a way how users can send encrypted mails to security@bitcoincore.org

This is a challenge in itself. I know of no way to do encrypted group addresses. Some security reporting addresses use a shared private GPG key specifically generated for that purpose, but after retiring the alert key we're probably not too happy to adapt private shared keys. Though this one would be used for reading mail only I guess...

Yes. It's a challenge and involves writing to specific developers.
But IMO – unencrypted emails – slightly defeats the purpose of "responsible disclosed submitting" of security critical issues.
But we can discuss that further on https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoincore.org

Yes, this discussion belongs there.

But... It would be nice to be able to encrypt such message inside the Bitcoin Core UI, using 1-of-n concept.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@ This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to bitcoin-core.
 
 General bitcoin questions and/or support requests and are best directed to the [Bitcoin StackExchange](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com).
 
+For reporting security issues, please use [security@bitcoincore.org](mailto:security@bitcoincore.org).
comments.body:
Indeed. The discussion belongs there, and so does the documentation. Maybe refer to the instructions for reporting security issues on the contact page: https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/ instead of mentioning the address directly?
If we then happen to have GPG set up, it can be mentioned there without having to put everything into this template.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@ This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to bitcoin-core.
 
 General bitcoin questions and/or support requests and are best directed to the [Bitcoin StackExchange](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com).
 
+For reporting security issues, please use [security@bitcoincore.org](mailto:security@bitcoincore.org).
comments.body: I wanted to do so first, but the URLs are fragile and can change. And when the separate "Report security issues" page happens at bitcoincore.org, we will have to change URL here. Mail will probably be the same.

comments.body: I think https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/ will always be the page for contact, even if there is a subsection with a list of gpg keys.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@ This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to bitcoin-core.

comments.body: How can you predict it will be a subsection? What if en-GB speakers will ask for en-GB and en-US page?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@ This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to bitcoin-core.
 
 General bitcoin questions and/or support requests and are best directed to the [Bitcoin StackExchange](https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com).
 
+For reporting security issues, please use [security@bitcoincore.org](mailto:security@bitcoincore.org).
comments.body:
"I wanted to do so first, but the URLs are fragile and can change" so are email addresses.
It's not impossible to update this again, it just should be rare.
